DOC.brief_summary: Study Hypothesis : A virtual peer-to-peer support intervention improve health outcome quality life adolescent Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis
DOC.brief_title: Virtual Peer-to-Peer ( VP2P ) Support Mentoring Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis ( JIA ) : A Pilot RCT
DOC.detailed_description: The aim project develop examine impact virtual peer support program health outcome quality life adolescent Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis use waitlist randomize controlled trial . In addition standard medical care , adolescent experimental group receive manualized peer mentorship program provide model reinforcement train young adult age 16-25 year learn function successfully pain . Mentoring session consist 10 session 30-45 minute Skype call 8 week . Feasibility program measure addition quality life , physical emotional symptom , pain coping , self-efficacy , social support , self-management skill .
